title.narrative: Integrated Social Protection & Education for Vulnerable Children in Jordan
Integrerat socialt skydd och utbildningstjanster for utsatta barn i Jordanien

description.narrative: The intervention aims to Enhance access to basic services and livelihood for vulnerable school-aged children (Syrian refugees, Jordanians and others), either at risk of dropping out of school or currently out of school, and support their enrolment and retention in education services over a period of 12 months. The only difference between this project and the previous one is that the first one was solely focusing on social protection, however this project includes a major component on social protection and a small component on non-formal education (drop out specifically). This project has 2 specific objectives: 1) Drop-out rate decreases and enrollment rate increases in primary schools, following alleviation of financial pressure on vulnerable families. 2) Access to certified non-formal education increases and expands for vulnerable young women and men currently not eligible for public schools

Denna insats syftar till att förbättra tillgången till grundläggande sociala tjänster och försörjning för utsatta barn i skolåldern (insatsen omfattar såväl syriska flyktingar, som jordanier och andra). Barnen är antingen i riskzonen för att lämna skolan eller har låg närvaro i skolan och projektet bidrar till att deras behov av utbildning och skydd ökar. Projektet omfattar följande två resultatområden:
1) Avhoppen inom skolsystemet minskar och inskrivningsgraden i skolorna ökar, efter att de ekonomiska möjligheterna för utsatta familjer förbättrats.
2) Tillgången till certifierad icke-formell utbildning ökar, möjligheterna ökar därmed också för utsatta unga kvinnor och män som för närvarande inte är berättigade till det offentliga skolsystemet.
Den totala budgeten för detta bidrag är 20 000 000 SEK som täcker en aktivitetsperiod från 1 september 2019 till 31 augusti 2020.

This intervention aims at enhancing access to basic services and livelihood for vulnerable school-aged children (Syrian refugees, Jordanians and others). The children are either at risk of dropping out of school or are currently out of school and the Project supports their enrolment and retention in education services with two specific outcomes:
1) Drop-out rate decreases and enrollment rate increases in primary schools, following alleviation of financial pressure on vulnerable families.
2) Access to certified non-formal education increases and expands for vulnerable young women and men currently not eligible for public schools.
The total budget of this contribution is 20 000 000 SEK that covers an activity period form 01 September 2019 till 31 August 2020.

tag.narrative: 1.3 - Implement nationally appropriate social protection systems and measures for all, including floors, and by 2030 achieve substantial coverage of the poor and the vulnerable.
1.3 - Införa nationellt lämpliga system och åtgärder för socialt skydd för alla, inklusive grundskydd, och senast 2030 säkerställa att de omfattar en väsentlig andel av de fattiga och de utsatta.
4.1 - By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes.
4.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla flickor och pojkar fullbordar avgiftsfri och likvärdig grundskole- och gymnasieutbildning av god kvalitet som leder till relevanta och ändamålsenliga kunskaper.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
It is reported that the activities are making a difference in the lives of the enrolled children. The programme has led to :
-10,281 girls and boys were reached with integrated social protection services during the 2019/2020 academic year of which 4,258 with Sida support.
- Overall decrease to 3 per cent in school drop-out rate among eligible girls and boys.
- 10 per cent increase in enrolment rate among eligible children
- Cumulatively enrolled 10,182 girls and boys who were previously out of school, in Drop-Out classes of which 410 with Sida support.
- 1,500 girls and boys in reached with Drop-Out services in refugee camps (Zaatari and Azraq camps) of which 410 girls and boys with Sida support.
- In summary, 957 girls and boys promoted to the next cycle within the Drop Out programme (passed from Cycles 1, 2 and 3) or 82 per cent of children enrolled of which 34 girls and boys with Sida support.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
